componentDescription: Responsively hides children based on the selected implementation.

implementation.description: Specify which implementation to use.  'js' is the default, 'css' works better for server-side rendering.

initialWidth.description:
You can use this prop when choosing the js implementation with server-side rendering.
As window.innerWidth is unavailable on the server, we default to rendering an empty component during the first mount. You might want to use a heuristic to approximate the screen width of the client browser screen width.
For instance, you could be using the user-agent or the client-hints. https://caniuse.com/#search=client%20hint

lgDown.description: If true, screens this size and down are hidden.

lgUp.description: If true, screens this size and up are hidden.

mdDown.description: If true, screens this size and down are hidden.

mdUp.description: If true, screens this size and up are hidden.

smDown.description: If true, screens this size and down are hidden.

smUp.description: If true, screens this size and up are hidden.

xlDown.description: If true, screens this size and down are hidden.

xlUp.description: If true, screens this size and up are hidden.

xsDown.description: If true, screens this size and down are hidden.

xsUp.description: If true, screens this size and up are hidden.
